Baccalaureate and must not be reproduced or distributed to any
other person without the authorization of the IB Global Centre,
Cardiff.
                                                                      –3–                                          N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                  Answers                                                 Notes                             Total
1.     a    i    nCuSO4 «  0.0800 dm3  0.200 mol dm–3 »  0.0160 mol AND
                              3.26 g
                 nFe «                   »  0.0584 mol ✔
                           55.85 g m ol1
                                                                                                                                          2

                 CuSO4 is the limiting reactant ✔                            Do not award M2 if mole calculation is not shown.


1.     a    ii   ALTERNATIVE 1:                                              Accept answers in the range 8586 %.
                 « 0.0160 mol  63.55 g mol–1  » 1.02 «g» ✔                 Award [2] for correct final answer.

                 « 0. 87 2 g  100  » 85.5 «%» ✔
                     1.0 2 g

                                                                                                                                          2
                 ALTERNATIVE 2:
                       0.872 g
                 «                    » 0.0137 «mol» ✔
                     63.55 g m ol –1
                     0.0137 m ol
                 «                100  » 85.6 «%» ✔
                     0.0160 m ol
                                                                                –4–                                    N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                                      Notes                        Total
1.     b    i    ALTERNATIVE 1:
                 q  «80.0 g  4.18 J g–1 K–1  7.5 K » 2.5  103 «J»/2.5 «kJ» ✔
                                           2.5 kJ
                 «per mol of CuSO4                  1.6  102 kJ mol–1»
                                         0.0160 mol
                 «for the reaction» H 1.6  102 «kJ» ✔
                                                                                               Award [2] for correct final answer.

                 ALTERNATIVE 2:                                                                                                                    2
                 q  «80.0 g    4.18 J g–1 K1    7.5 K » 2.5    103 «J»/2.5 «kJ» ✔
                           0.872
                 « nCu           0.0137 mol »
                           63.55
                                           2.5 kJ
                 «per mol of CuSO4                  1.8  102 kJ mol–1»
                                         0.0137 mol
                 «for the reaction» H 1.8  102 «kJ» ✔

1.     b    ii   density «of solution» is 1.00 g cm–3                                          The mark for “reaction goes to completion”
                 OR                                                                            can only be awarded if 0.0160 mol was used
                                                                                               in part (b)(i).
                 specific heat capacity «of solution» is 4.18 J g–1 K–1/that of «pure» water
                                                                                               Do not accept “heat loss”.
                 OR                                                                                                                                1
                 reaction goes to completion
                 OR
                 iron/CuSO4 does not react with other substances ✔


                                                                                                                                            (continued…)

(Question 1b continued)

      Question                                    Answers                               Notes                     Total
 1.     b    iii   ALTERNATIVE 1:
                                                                  Accept values in the range 4.1–5.5 «kJ».
                   «0.2 °C  100  » 3 %/0.03 ✔
                           7.5 °C                                 Award [2] for correct final answer.
                   «0.03  160 kJ»  «±» 5 «kJ» ✔
                                                                                                                   2
                   ALTERNATIVE 2:

                   «0.2 °C  100  » 3 %/0.03 ✔
                           7.5 °C

                   «0.03  180 kJ»  «±» 5 «kJ» ✔
                                                                          –6–                                            N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                     Answers                                                         Notes                         Total
1.     c    i




                                                                                                                                                 2




                  initial concentration is zero AND concentration increases with time ✔
                  decreasing gradient as reaction proceeds ✔

1.     c    ii    «draw a» tangent to the curve at time  0 ✔                             Accept suitable diagram.
                  «rate equals» gradient/slope «of the tangent» ✔                                                                                2


1.     c    iii   piece has smaller surface area ✔                                        Accept “chance/probability” instead of “frequency”.
                                                                                          Do not accept just “fewer collisions”.
                  lower frequency of collisions                                                                                                  2
                  OR
                  fewer collisions per second/unit time ✔
                                                          –7–                                N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                   Answers                                Notes                           Total
1.     d        Anode (positive electrode):                     Accept “4OH – (aq)  O2 (g)  2H2O (l)  4e –”
                2H2O (l)  O2 (g)  4H (aq)  4e– ✔            OR “Fe2+ (aq)  Fe3+ (aq)  e –” for M1.


                Cathode (negative electrode):
                2H2O (l) 2e–  H2 (g) 2OH – (aq)            Accept “Fe2+ (aq)  2e–  Fe (s)” OR
                OR                                              “SO42- (aq)  4H+ (aq)  2e–  2H2SO3(aq)  H2O (l)”
                                                                for M2.                                                 2
                2H  (aq)  2e–  H2 (g) ✔
                                                                   –8–                                  N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                 Answers                                             Notes                       Total
2.     a        «in 100 g sample»     62.02 g
                                                  AND 10.43 g 1
                                    12.01 g mol1    1.01 g mol
                OR
                «in 100 g sample» 5.164 mol C AND 10.33 mol H ✔


                27.55 %                                                                                                        3

                OR
                1.722 mol O ✔


                «empirical formula» C3H6O ✔

2.     b        «absorption at wavenumber 17001750 cm–1» C=O/carbonyl ✔   Do not accept “ketone” or “aldehyde”.               1

2.     c        «m/z » 58 ✔                                                                                                   1

2.     d

                                                                                                                               1
                CH3COCH3 /                       ✔

     Question                                  Answers                                    Notes                     Total
3.     a    i    1s2 2s2 2p6 3s2 3p6 4s2 3d10 4p5                  Accept 3d before 4s.
                 OR                                                                                                  1
                 [Ar] 4s2 3d10 4p5 ✔

3.     a    ii                                                     Accept double-headed arrows.




                                                                                                                     1




                                                         ✔
                                                                         – 10 –                                        N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M



     Question                                    Answers                                                        Notes                          Total
3.     b    i    Structure I  follows octet rule:                                       Accept dots, crosses or lines to represent electron
                                                                                         pairs.




                                                               ✔
                                                                                                                                                2
                 Structure II  does not follow octet rule:




                                     OR                        ✔

3.     b    ii   «structure I» formal charge on Br  +2                                  Ignore any reference to formal charge on oxygen.
                 OR
                 «structure II» formal charge on Br  0/+1 ✔                                                                                    2


                 structure II is preferred AND it produces formal charge closer to 0 ✔
                                                                           – 11 –                                     N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                      Answers                                                         Notes                        Total
3.     c          Geometry:
                  trigonal/pyramidal ✔


                  Reason:
                  three bonds AND one lone pair
                                                                                                                                                 3
                  OR
                  four electron domains ✔                                                     Accept “charge centres” for “electron domains”.


                  OBrO angle:                                                               Accept answers in the range 104109°.
                  107° ✔

3.     d    i     BrO3– (aq)  6e–  6H (aq)  Br – (aq)  3H2O (l)                          Accept reversible arrows.
                  correct reactants and products ✔                                                                                               2
                  balanced equation ✔

3.     d    ii    BrO3– (aq)  6Fe2 (aq)  6H (aq)  Br – (aq)  3H2O (l)  6Fe3 (aq) ✔                                                       1

3.     d    iii   E Öreaction  «1.44 V – 0.77 V » 0.67 «V» ✔
                                                                                                                                                 2
                  G Ö  «nFE Öreaction  – 6  96500 C mol–1  0.67 V » –3.9  105 «J» ✔

3.     e          both are paramagnetic ✔                                                    Accept orbital diagrams for both ions showing
                                                                                              unpaired electrons.                                2
                  «both» contain unpaired electrons ✔
                                                                       – 12 –                                      N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                    Answers                                                         Notes                   Total
4.     a        nuclear charge/number of protons/Zeff increases «causing a stronger pull on   Accept “atomic number” for “number of
                the outer electrons» ✔                                                        protons”.                                   2
                same number of shells/«outer» energy level/shielding ✔
4.     b        isoelectronic/same electronic configuration/«both» have 2.8 ✔
                                                                                                                                          2
                more protons in Na ✔

4.     c




                                                                                                                                          2




                Sketch showing:
                largest increase between third and fourth ionization energies ✔
                IE1 < IE2 < IE3 < IE4 < IE5 ✔
                                                                      – 13 –                             N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                   Answers                                              Notes                     Total
4.     d        Fe2 AND smaller size/radius                                    M1 not needed for M2.
                OR
                Fe2 AND higher charge density ✔                                                                                2


                stronger interaction with «polar» water molecules ✔




5.     a        all «species» are in same phase ✔                               Accept “all species are in same state”.
                                                                                                                                1
                                                                                Accept “all species are gases”.

5.     b        negative AND fewer moles/molecules «of gas» in the products ✔                                                   1

5.     c        G Ö «–RT ln Kc » –8.31 J K–1 mol–1  1000 K  ln 280         Award [2] for correct final answer.

                OR
                G Ö  – 4.7  104 «J» ✔                                                                                        2


                «G Ö » – 47 «kJ» ✔

5.     d        G Ö < 0/spontaneous AND S Ö < 0/unfavourable ✔
                                                                                                                                2
                exothermic AND H Ö «must be» negative/favourable ✔
                                                                              – 14 –                            N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                     Answers                                                   Notes                     Total
5.     e        «reaction quotient/Q »     [SO 3 ] 2       0.500 2
                                                        /                   / 2 0.8 ✔
                                          [SO 2 ] [O 2 ] 0.200 2  0 . 3 00
                                                 2




                reaction quotient/Q/20.8/answer < Kc/280
                OR                                                                                                                     3

                mixture needs more product for the number to equal Kc ✔


                reaction proceeds to the right/products ✔                               Do not award M3 without valid reasoning.
                                                                           – 15 –                           N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                              Notes                     Total
6.     a    i     Butanoic acid:
                  CH3CH2CH2COOH (aq)  H2O (l)  CH3CH2CH2COO– (aq)  H3O (aq) ✔
                                                                                                                                     2
                  Ethylamine:
                  CH3CH2NH2 (aq)  H2O (l)  CH3CH2NH3 (aq)  OH– (aq) ✔

6.     a    ii
                                                                                    Accept correct diagrams with pi clouds.
                                                                                                                                     1
                  Diagram showing:
                  dotted line along O–C–O AND negative charge

6.     a    iii   –1 ✔                                                                                                               1

6.     b    i     « 1.00  10
                                 –14
                                   m ol2 d m –6 »  5.21  10–12 «mol dm–3» ✔
                         0.001 92 m ol dm –3                                                                                         1

(Question 6b continued)

      Question                                            Answers                                     Notes                    Total
 6.     b    ii   «pKb  3.35, Kb  10–3.35 4.5  10–4»                        Award [3] for correct final answer.

                  «C2H5NH2  H2O  C2H5NH3  OH– »


                  Kb     [OH – ][CH 3 CH 2NH 3 + ]
                             [CH 3 CH 2NH 2 ]

                  OR
                                             [OH – ] [CH3 CH 2NH3 + ]
                  «Kb » 4.5  10–4 
                                                      0.250
                  OR
                                                                                                                                3
                                              x2
                  «Kb » 4.5  10   4
                                                    ✔
                                             0.250


                  « x  [OH] » 0.011 «mol dm3» ✔


                                1.00 × 10 –14
                  «pH   log                 » 12.04
                                   0.011
                  OR
                  «pH  14.00  (log 0.011)» 12.04 ✔
                                                                      – 17 –                N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                     Answers                                   Notes                 Total
6.     c




                                                                                                                   3




                decreasing pH curve ✔
                pH close to 7 (6–8) at volume of 25 cm3 butanoic acid ✔
                weak acid/base shape with no flat «strong acid/base» parts on the curve ✔
                                                                        – 18 –                                    N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                Answers                                                      Notes                         Total
6.     d         Any two of:
                 butanoic acid forms more/stronger hydrogen bonds ✔               Accept “butanoic acid forms dimers”.
                 butanoic acid forms stronger London/dispersion forces ✔          Accept “butanoic acid has larger Mr /hydrocarbon
                                                                                  chain/number of electrons” for M2.
                 butanoic acid forms stronger dipole–dipole interaction/force ✔
                                                                                  Accept “butanoic acid has larger «permanent»
                                                                                  dipole/more polar” for M3.                           2 max




6.     e    i    lithium aluminium hydride/LiAlH4 ✔                                                                                      1

6.     e    ii   butan-1-ol/1-butanol/CH3CH2CH2CH2OH ✔                                                                                   1
                                                                          – 19 –                                    N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                        Notes                  Total
7.     a        «electrophilic» addition/AE                                                       Accept “hydrogenation”.
                OR                                                                                                                         1
                reduction ✔

7.     b        «(286 kJ)  (1411 kJ) » 1697 «kJ» ✔                                                                                    1

7.     c        «1697 kJ  1561 kJ » 136 «kJ»
                OR                                                                                                                         1
                     Ö
                «H     HÖ
                           f (products)     HÖ
                                               f (reactants)     84 kJ  52 kJ » 136 «kJ» ✔
                                                                        – 20 –                            N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                             Answers                                           Notes               Total
7.     d        Accurate:
                no approximations were made in the cycle
                OR
                values are specific to the compounds
                OR
                Hess’s law is a statement of conservation of energy
                OR
                method is based on a law
                OR
                data in table has small uncertainties ✔


                Approximate:                                                                                                     2
                values were experimentally determined/had uncertainties
                OR
                each value has been determined to only three/four significant figures
                OR
                different sources have «slightly» different values for enthalpy of combustion
                OR
                law is valid until disproved
                OR
                law of conservation of energy is now conservation of mass-energy
                OR
                small difference between two quite large terms «leads to high percentage uncertainty» ✔
                                                                       – 21 –                          N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                            Notes                      Total
8.     a         angle between bonds is 60°/strained/smaller than 109.5° ✔                                                         1
8.     b    i    Any two of:                                                          Accept displayed or condensed
                                                                                      structural formulas or skeletal formulas.
                 CH3COCH3 ✔
                                                                                      Accept CH(OH)=CHCH3 and
                 CH3CH2CHO ✔                                                          CH2=C(OH)CH3.
                 CH2=CHCH2OH ✔
                 CH3OCH=CH2 ✔                                                                                                      2


                               ✔


                         ✔

8.     b    ii   no AND only one «axial/methyl/CH3» substituent «at the ring»         Accept “no AND «O in the ring and»
                                                                                      one carbon has two H atoms”.
                 OR                                                                                                                1
                 no AND two «axial» substituents required «for cis/trans-isomers» ✔

8.     c         Chemical shift:
                 3.74.8 «ppm» ✔
                                                                                                                                   2
                 Splitting pattern:
                 doublet ✔
                                                                      – 22 –                                       N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                       Answers                                                         Notes                       Total
9.     a        polarity/polar «molecule/bond»
                OR                                                                                                                               1
                carbonhalogen bond is weaker than CH bond ✔

9.     b        primary AND Br/bromine is attached to a carbon bonded to two hydrogens            Accept “primary AND Br/bromine is
                OR                                                                                attached to the first carbon in the chain”.
                                                                                                                                                 1
                primary AND Br/bromine is attached to a carbon bonded to one C/R/alkyl
                «group» ✔

9.     c                                                                                          Do not allow curly arrow originating on
                                                                                                  H in HO –.
                                                                                                  Accept curly arrow either going from
                                                                                                  bond between C and Br to Br in
                                                                                                  1-bromopropane or in the transition
                                                                                                  state.
                curly arrow going from lone pair/negative charge on O in HO  to C ✔              Do not penalize if HO and Br are not at
                                                                                                  180° to each other.
                curly arrow showing Br leaving ✔
                                                                                                  Do not award M3 if OHC bond is
                representation of transition state showing negative charge, square brackets and   represented.
                partial bonds ✔                                                                                                                  4

                formation of organic product CH3CH2CH2OH AND Br – ✔




9.     d        «Lewis» base AND donates a pair of electrons ✔                                                                                   1
                                                                      – 23 –                              N18/4/CHEMI/HP2/ENG/TZ0/XX/M


     Question                                          Answers                                            Notes                 Total
9.     e        Any two of:                                                                Accept other reasonable answers.
                choose «most» appropriate reaction «for preparing the target compound» ✔
                design/discover new reactions/reagents ✔
                apply this knowledge to other areas of chemistry/science ✔
                «retro-»synthesis «more effective» ✔
                                                                                                                               2 max
                control/predict «desired» products ✔
                control rate of reaction «more effectively» ✔
                satisfy intellectual curiosity ✔
                predicting how changing reagents/conditions might affect reaction ✔
                suggesting intermediates/transition states ✔



10.    a        B: reactant ✔
                                                                                                                                 2
                D: intermediate ✔

10.    b        rate  k [A][B] ✔                                                                                                1

10.    c        1.80 «mol dm–3 s–1» ✔                                                                                            1
